Pre-Game Insights: Brazil boss Dorival Junior experienced disappointment in his first tournament in charge of the national team after he saw his side eliminated in the quarter-finals of the Copa America.
Despite overseeing an underwhelming tournament, Dorival can still take some comfort from the fact that he has not lost in regulation time in any of his eight matches in charge.
Brazil may view qualification as a formality, but they have work to do after winning two, drawing one and losing three of their first six qualifiers.
Brazil will be confident of taking something from Friday's contest against Ecuador, having avoided defeat in each of their last 12 head-to-head matches.
Ecuador's all-time leading scorer Enner Valencia will spearhead the attack, and he will be looking to add to the 41 goals that he has scored for his country.
With Raphinha suspended, Dorival could decide to select an all-Real Madrid forward line of Rodrygo, Vinicius Junior and Endrick.
